titles.title: 614 How Shall I Follow Him I Serve (familiar tune

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
How shall I follow Him I serve
How shall I copy Him I love
Nor from those blessed
Footsteps swerve
Which lead me to His seat above

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Privations sorrows bitter scorn
The life of toil the mean abode
The faithless kiss the crown of thorn
Are these the consecrated road

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Lord should my path
Through suff'ring lie
Forbid it I should e'er repine
Still let me turn to Calvary
Nor heed my griefs
Remembering Thine

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
O let me think how Thou didst leave
Untasted every pure delight
To fast - to faint - to watch - to grieve
The toilsome day - the homeless night

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
To faint - to grieve - to die for me
Thou camest not Thyself to please
And dear as earthly comforts be
Shall I not love Thee more than these

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
Yes I would count them all but loss
To gain the notice of Thine eye
Flesh shrinks and trembles at the cross
But Thou canst give the victory
